data.title: Communities of Practice: The Organizational Frontier
data.meta_description: Not so long ago, companies were reinvented by teams. Communities of practice may reinvent them yet again—if managers learn to cultivate these fertile organizational forms without destroying them.
data.text:
EW

Etienne C. Wenger is a consultant on knowledge management and communities of practice and the author of Communities of Practice: Learning, Meaning, and Identity (Cambridge University Press, 1998). He is based in North San Juan, California.

WS

William M. Snyder is a founding partner of Social Capital Group, a research and consulting firm in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
